oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 2 from oral history interview with Joseph R. O'Donnell, 2003 July 07
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Joseph R. O'Donnell, conducted on 7 July 2003 by Robert P. Richardson as part of the Nashville Public Library's Veterans History Project. After his separation from service as a Marine photographer in the late 1940s, he worked for the United States Information Agency (USIA) as the White House photographer, and he kept a photographic record of his association with five US presidents - Truman, Eisenhower, Kennedy, Johnson, and Nixon. In this excerpt, O'Donnell discusses a humorous incident involving Eleanor Roosevelt. The complete interview, as well as a transcript, is available in the repository.
